overview:
With more than 25 years of wireless experience, Denise Archer specializes in providing strategic guidance and operational knowledge to mobile start-up companies, with an emphasis on scaling high-growth ventures and achieving fundamental business milestones.

As vice president of carrier partnerships and media communications for BilltoMobile, she directed mobile carrier sales and strategic relationship development, and represented mobile operator needs in BilltoMobile’s product development cycle. During her tenure, the company became the only payments provider to directly connect its mobile billing platform with all four tier-one U.S. wireless carriers. She remains a member of the BilltoMobile board of advisors.

Previously she served as the anchor sales executive at Boston Communications Group, Inc. (BCGI), and was a member of the founding executive team. BCGI was recognized as a pioneer in the development of cellular prepaid service and debuted in a successful initial public offering on NASDAQ during her tenure. At its peak, the company processed 60 percent of all North American wireless prepaid calls.

Prior to BCGI, she held the position of senior vice president of sales and marketing at Appex, a wireless carrier service provider for roaming fraud control and billing, and one of the first wireless roaming clearinghouses in the U.S. The company earned BusinessWeek’s title of Fastest Growing Privately Held Company in the U.S. and was subsequently was sold to Electronic Data Systems (EDS).

Denise started her career in the wireless industry with various positions at major wireless carrier organizations including PacTel Mobile, Metro One (now AT&T’s NY/NJ market), and a division of Bell Atlantic Mobile.
